intro: Gaultheria mekonggaensis, commonly known as the Mekongga wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Gaultheria mekonggaensis produces berries that are typically red or black when mature, containing seeds surrounded by a fleshy aril. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats at high elevations, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
